Modeling the Capital Structure

This project is intended to capture the idea of capital structure, as presented in the works of Ludwig von Mises, Ludwig Lachmann, Israel Kirzner, and others.

The project is being worked on by Manxueying Li.

Bibiliography

Design of the model

What is Austrian Business Cycle Theory (ABCT)?

Austrian Business Cycle Theory (ABCT) developed by Austrian school of economics views business cycle as a result of artificially low interest rate leading to the imbalance between saving and investment. Low interest rate stimulates business investment because of the lower cost of borrowing money. More investment bid up prices for capital goods increasing the cost of production along with the false information about sufficient recourse cause the uncompleted production of final products which are not capable of turning into profit. As a result, companies are not able to sell their product and a lot of resources are being wasted leading to an economic downturn.

Why agent-based modeling?

The agents are "computational objects modeled as interacting according to rules". The rules are designed to model behavior and social interactions based on incentives and information. The foundimental thing in ABCT is individual choice when facing certain forms of central bank activity and "agent" in the model can represent individual, social groups in the economic system. The phenomenon observed in the economy can be represented by the interaction of multiple agent.

What I learned from "Does austrian business cycle theory help explain the dot-com boom and bust?"

The boom and bust happened during 1995 and 2000 is observed in the enormous increase and rapid decline in stock price and Internet-related assets. The increase in new money led to increase in liquidity, and, as a result, bid up the price of capital goods making some of the business plan not feasible (exceed production posibility frontier). As the interest rate kept low, the consumer in the artificial boom will make malinvestment and over-consumption leading to a further increase in housing market and debt to equity ratio.

What I learned from "Capital and its structure"

how firm invest in capital goods and creating capital structure. key concept: heterogeneous and complimentary

  • equilibrium: all value consistent with each other —> money as measurement of capital change
  • Capital structure consists of heterogeneous capitals, and each of them only be used for limited purpose
  • Capitals are scarce resources with alternative use, therefore, they should be capable of turning into goods and services and fit into each other(complementary goods)
  • what determine the capital structure? production plan (mkt force) -> revising at the end of successful period -> predictable
  • business starts with homogeneous money capital (free capital) and then de-homogenize one capital (investing in other capitals)
  • capital accumulation —> change in capital structure
  • people are on the track of finding the best solution —> moving toward equilibrium; but in process analysis, people will not consistent with each other (equilibrium decision making unit + disequilibrium)
  • capital coefficient: proportion in which the various types of equipment are combined with the plant
  • supplementary capital good: quantitative change can be an indicator for the success and failure.
  • capital regrouping based on envision(depend on cheap complimentary R): depreciation & buy and sell price unknown before transaction complete --> idle money, a indicator of success regrouping
  • Boehm-Bawerk: "period of production" increase and cause an increase in output of man per hour. Thinking of capital goods as ‘mass of intermediate products’ --> heterogeneous product
  • Change in capital is governed by change in income -- interest
    • IR
    • ER
  • intertemporal market: the own-rates net of carrying cost tend towards equality which is the market equilibrium, since if the own-rate different, the "sawp" will occur, forcing it to move towards the equilibrium.
    • /li>

What I learned from "Economics for Real People"

notes for cpt8 "Make a new plan, stan":

Society's capital good is not a quantitative measurement since the capital goods only have value once there exist a buyer for them. Different from Neoclassical and Keynesian that those capital are just numbers that could be fed into mathematical equitions, Austrian regards society's capital good is more of its "interlocking structure of individual plans" rather than just numbers.

  • Capital good is part of people's plan, and same capital good can have different use/role to other person. What really matter is what role it's playing rather than what it really is.
  • new capital will be added to the plan only if its enconomic efficiency
  • roundabout method of production: increase productivity by implementing more time-consumming method.
  • Complementarity plus indivisibility
  • introduce new capitals is complementary has reached certain size
  • ‘Higher roundabout productivity’:resist the pressure of diminishing returns is by changing the composition of capital and enlisting an indivisibility which, with fewer complementary capital resources, could not have been used.
  • "capital accumulation therefore means, firstly, an increase in the number of processing stages and, secondly, a change in the composition of the raw material flow as well as of the capital combinations at each stage, reflecting specialization as new stages are being added to the existing structure"
